result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany L. Knapp

defendant.name: Knapp, Brittany L.
defendant.address: PO Box 189, c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Phoenix, MD 21131

records.addlTxt:
9:47 AM Defendant Brittany L. Knapp appeared by video from Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Brittany L. Knapp.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement and requests a Pre-Sentence Investigation Report (PSI).
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated and the request for a PSI.
Court questions defendant regarding appearing remotely for today's hearing.
Court informs defendant that if she wanted to appear in person, she could be transported here for this hearing. 
Defendant understands and still wishes to appear remotely.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions defendant regarding plea.
Court informs defendant of the constitutional rights. 
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1. 

Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.

Atty Sheets asks if Ms. Knapp can appear remotely for the sentencing hearing for reasons states on record.
Court questions Ms. Knapp and informs her that it is her right to appear in person.

BY THE COURT: Court does not object to Ms. Knapp appearing remotely.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI Investigation
PSI to be delivered to all parties by December 30th.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 10, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights filed by Atty Eric Sheets
Order on Request to Appear Remotely /s/ MDZ 11/01/22
Order on Request to Appear Remotely filed by Atty Eric Sheets (Sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/31/22 sp)
Defendant's Request to Appear Remotely filed by Atty Eric Sheets (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/31/22 sp)

Filed by Prosecutor.

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance filed by Atty Eric Sheets

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:15 PM Defendant Brittany L. Knapp appeared by video, in custody at Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Brittany L. Knapp.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of Kelly A Cassidy for the  State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that she can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with her attorney.
Atty Sheets will be filing a waiver of right to personal appearance.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
